posts.cooked: A week ago our RoboRio2 started showing the unrecoverable error code on the status light. I have tried all the troubleshooting tips that I found online and none worked. Some of the tips I found were reformatting the SD card, getting a new image, and getting a new SD card. None have worked. We have two rio 1‚Äôs that we used at the comp this past weekend but we are hoping to get the rio 2 working for our upcoming comp. Please help.

posts.name: thomasjosif
posts.cooked: Can you describe how you are formatting the SD card?

posts.name: Mr.R^2
posts.cooked: To add to this, after you format the card, are you setting up the Rio after using the Rio imaging tool?

I may be doing this wrong. But I and taking the SD card into a dongle, connecting it to my computer, and extracting the file from the folder in the imaging tool and sending it to the SD card. Then ejecting the device and putting the SD card back in the rio. When I originally set up the rio I did that exact process and it worked fine until a week ago.
I can‚Äôt as soon as I power on the rio it goes into that unrecoverable error state.

posts.name: Chris Gerth
posts.cooked:
The instructions indicate to use balenaEtcher or the Raspberry Pi Imaging tool:

The NI roboRIO 2.0 boots from a microSD card configured with an appropriate boot image containing the NI Linux Real-Time OS, drivers, and libraries specific to FRC. The microSD card must be imaged ...

While I won‚Äôt claim with certainty that your method won‚Äôt work, it might be better to use the documented process to take out a variable in your debugging operation.

link_counts.title: Imaging your roboRIO 2 ‚Äî FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.cooked: I will try that and give u an update.

posts.name: Mr.R^2
posts.cooked:
Another thing to try is to use a different USB cable and port (or computer).

Also, we had this happen last season when two of the pins were shorted (DIO or PWM I believe, but I think it could happen to any) after getting hit really hard by an intake while playing defense. I would check that too.

Since the other RIO is working, it sounds unlikely that it is a shorted cable on the robot, but, it could be pins on the RIO.

posts.name: Emerson OHara
posts.cooked: Have you taken the RoboRIO 2.0 apart and cleaned it out, sometimes shavings can get in there and cause malfunctions even with the conformal coating. Last year we had a roboRIO 2.0 do something similar and I got it working after comp by cleaning everything and reassembling. It‚Äôs still marked as a ‚Äúquestionable‚Äù RIO but we did test that it was working after a full clean.
thank you everyone we got it working.

posts.name: Kyle
posts.cooked: Make sure that there aren‚Äôt any metal shavings in the USB, DIO, PWM , or other ports. We were seeing it when we had a metal shaving in our USB port.
